sentences.english: He had many elegancies of his own, whilst he scoffed at conventional elegance.
sentences.chinese: 他本人便具備很多優雅，儘管他在譏笑常規的優雅。

sentences.english: The next year- he published The Rape of the Lock- an attemptodst mock epic.
sentences.chinese: 次年，他又出版了《奪發記》，一部極妙的譏笑史詩。

sentences.english: A wise son heeds his fathers instruction , but a mocker does not listen to rebuke .
sentences.chinese: 智慧的兒子聽從父親的教訓，好譏笑人的不聽責備。

sentences.english: Pedants sneer at an education which is useful.
sentences.chinese: 迂腐之士譏笑學以致用的教育。

sentences.english: 'If you are so brave why don't you go?'they jeered.
sentences.chinese: “如果你這麼勇敢，爲什麼你不去呢？”他們譏笑着。

sentences.english: Let not the sword-blade mock its handle for being blunt.
sentences.chinese: 不要讓劍刃譏笑劍柄的鈍拙。

sentences.english: Having been laughed at for his lameness, the boy became shy and inhibited.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩因跛腳被人譏笑，變得羞怯而壓抑。

sentences.english: They dare not break the herd, afraid of the ridicule of their neighbours.
sentences.chinese: 他們怕鄰居譏笑，不敢獨斷獨行。

sentences.english: The foolish boy actor was laughed at wherever he went.
sentences.chinese: 這愚笨的男兒童演員不論走到哪裏都受到譏笑。

sentences.english: The earthworm mocks the dragon for neither crawling through the dirt nor living in the soil.
sentences.chinese: 蚯蚓譏笑蛟龍既不爬行於泥中也不生活在土裏。

sentences.english: A laughing - stock, a thing of shame.
sentences.chinese: 一個譏笑或是一個痛苦的羞辱。

sentences.english: He jests at scars,that never felt a wound.
sentences.chinese: 從未受過傷的人，纔會譏笑別人的傷疤。

sentences.english: The noise of the moment scoffs at the music of the eternal.
sentences.chinese: 短暫的噪音總是譏笑那永恆的音樂。

sentences.english: Later, someone persuade him that his fears were groundless. This idioms satirizes those who worry unnecessary.
sentences.chinese: 成語杞人憂天譏笑那些沒有必要或毫無根據的憂慮。

sentences.english: They ll teautomotive service engineers you since re different- or for no good reason.
sentences.chinese: 他們譏笑你由於你不同，而在沒有更好的理由。

sentences.english: In the universe of which Don Juan has a glimpse, ridicule too is included. He would consider it normal to be chastised.
sentences.chinese: 唐璜隱約窺探到的宇宙中也包括奚落和譏笑。

definition: lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
tone sandhi/modified tone/(music) to change key/modulation
to condemn in speech and in writing (idiom)/to denounce by word and pen
to mention sth without elaborating (idiom); not giving details
to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
universally shocking/to offend the whole of society
to plot and kill sb for his property (idiom); to murder for money
